texts.definition: Changes over time to teams due to changes in the game state or player skills.
markups: <style="Definition">Changes over time to teams due to changes in the game state or player skills.</style>
Many games make use of teams. Those that let the teams change over time - for whatever reason - have <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style>.

Real world <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Sports">Sports</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Basketball">Basketball</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ice%20Hockey">Ice Hockey</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Soccer">Soccer</link></style> have <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style> as team members gain experience from training and playing matches. Of course, recruiting new team members can provide <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style> as well. E-sports with stable teams, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Counter-Strike%20series">Counter-Strike</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/League%20of%20Legends">League of Legends</link></style> have the same type of <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style>. Games where individual players control whole teams, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Bloodbowl">Bloodbowl</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Football%20Manager%20series">Football Manager series</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hattrick">Hattrick</link></style>, nearly always provide gameplay choices related to <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style>. This is also the case for many games in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/FIFA%20series">FIFA series</link></style>.

The improvements (and possibly disadvantages) that individual characters gain over time in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Tabletop%20Roleplaying%20Games">Tabletop Roleplaying Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dungeons%20&%20Dragons">Dungeons & Dragons</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/GURPS">GURPS</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Warhammer%20Fantasy%20Roleplay">Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay</link></style> typically provide <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style> as players often play as members of parties.

Designing for <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style> mainly consists of how <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> should be able to improve and what aspects of them can be improved. A primary influence on these choices is what the <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> consists of. In the case of <style="Link"><link="characters">Characters</link></style>, any type of <style="Link"><link="character-development">Character Development</link></style> also causes <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style>. In <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> of players, <style="Link"><link="further-player-improvement-potential">Further Player Improvement Potential</link></style> or the possibility of <style="Link"><link="gameplay-mastery">Gameplay Mastery</link></style> instead provide means for the <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> to develop. More specifically modifying <style="Link"><link="characteristics">Characteristics</link></style> or providing <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved Abilities</link></style> can be used to instantiate <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style>, either on individual <style="Link"><link="characters">Characters</link></style> in the <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> or on <style="Link"><link="abstract-player-constructs">Abstract Player Constructs</link></style> if they are use to describe the <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style>. In games where <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> exist longer than single game instances, training members through <style="Link"><link="extra-game-actions">Extra-Game Actions</link></style> is another way to allow <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style>. In these cases, the introduction of <style="Link"><link="coaches">Coaches</link></style> can be considered to let somebody specialize in this activity as well as tactical and strategical decision making during gameplay.
<style="Link"><link="player-planned-development">Player-Planned Development</link></style> can be used to let players have influence over <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style> lets <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> evolve over gameplay time and typically requires some type of <style="Link"><link="resource-management">Resource Management</link></style>, and the development is often an <style="Link"><link="investments">Investment</link></style>. This quite clearly leads to <style="Link"><link="abstract-player-construct-development">Abstract Player Construct Development</link></style> in the cases where these <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> are <style="Link"><link="abstract-player-constructs">Abstract Player Constructs</link></style>. In games where the team members are players, this may give a feeling of <style="Link"><link="togetherness">Togetherness</link></style>. In both cases, individual members can gain <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Asymmetric%20Abilities">Asymmetric Abilities</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="competence-areas">Competence Areas</link></style>. In games where <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> are maintained over game instances, <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style> provides <style="Link"><link="extra-game-consequences">Extra-Game Consequences</link></style> and improving the <style="Link"><link="teams">Team</link></style> as much as possible becomes a <style="Link"><link="meta-games">Meta Game</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style> affects both <style="Link"><link="pvp">PvP</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="tvt">TvT</link></style> gameplay regarding <style="Link"><link="team-balance">Team Balance</link></style>. It can be used to both balance the powers of players within a team and balance teams against each other but this can be a fickle solution since <style="CurrentLink">Team Development</style> can easily also emphasis existing imbalances.

<style="Link"><link="abstract-player-construct-development">Abstract Player Construct Development</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Asymmetric%20Abilities">Asymmetric Abilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="competence-areas">Competence Areas</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="extra-game-consequences">Extra-Game Consequences</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="investments">Investments</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="meta-games">Meta Games</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="resource-management">Resource Management</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="togetherness">Togetherness</link></style>
